review_title: Meaningful place to work where you can make a difference
job_title: Professor in Ithaca, NY
pros: Interesting beautiful students, over 50% BIPOC. The students really need everything we have to offer them so it is an amazing and rewarding teaching opportunity. Excellent colleagues who really care.
cons: Public universities are currently under funded, particularly in some states including PA, this can mean that the funding is not always there for the good developmental ideas we come up with. Freshman and Sophomore classes can be too large for the needs of the population.

review_title: Residential Learning Coordinator - Residential & Dining Services
job_title: Graduate Assistant in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros:
- Management experience
- Developed Interpersonal skills
- Gained real life experience
- Hands-on work
- Learned the ins and outs of Higher Education
- Gained financial management skills
- Great resume builder
- Free housing was the biggest perk, along with a tuition deduction
cons:
- it is a full-time job, with full-time responsibilities while being a full-time college student
- 24/7 work environment, did not really have a break or moment to myself ever
- mental health/personal days were discouraged or ignored, even though this particular department is supposed to support the health and wellness of students/staff and faculty. 
- hourly pay was not-livable (despite the free housing). Still had to pay out of pocket for other necessities while only making under $300 biweekly.
- Lots of responsibilities and tasks were thrown on last minute, passed down from higher administration and professional staff members. The expectation was everything needed to be completed because the contract signed insinuated "responsibilities are not limited too".
- During the start of COVID- frontlines, professional staff members in the dorms were the last to receive proper safety-wear (including masks and gloves, etc.) However, they were still fully expected to interact with others, check rooms and risks exposing themselves.

job_title: Assistant Professor in East Stroudsburg, PA

cons: Some systems are not organized yet.

review_title: I found them good to work for except for the temporary nature of the arrangement.
job_title: "Company Owner, Director and Consultant" in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Great atmosphere in the department I was in.  Good colleagues.  Students were generally very good to work with.  Excellent benefits for my family.
cons: Temps don't get respect from other faculty or administration.  No path to get off the temporary treadmill if you can't get your PhD right away which wasn't financially feasible for me.  Could have done it part time while also dedicating myself to teaching but they only want PhDs due to state funding formulas.

review_title: Laid back, stress free, low pay.
job_title: Student Tutpr in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: There's not many people to answer to in the entire learning enrichment center it is very laid back.  You can pretty much make your own hours because you are working directly with student so you arrange when your meetings are.  Tutoring is full-filling because you are helping learn.  Managers are very easy to talk to and not in the least bit demanding or degrading, really nothing bad to say about superiors.
cons: Procedure seem to change frequently and it can get confusing. Since you are working with students it is sometime hard to meet up with them because they are still not fully mature. The pay is low and basically no room for growth.  No upper level classes are available for tutoring.

review_title: Great place to socialize and have parties. CLIQUES are the norm.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Plenty of parties and free food.  Great place to work if you like to spend your time socializing.  If you are an enabler you will fit in well here. If you enjoy the status quo and despise innovation you will thrive here.  If you enjoy gossiping and talking behind peoples backs instead of addressing the issue, this is the place for you.
cons: No strategic vision or goals established by management.  Poor communication from management. Management is very reactive. Very cliquey.
